revised_title: Investigations on Ultra-Penetrating Rays and Their Nature
tldr: The author discusses the properties and nature of ultra-penetrating rays, a type of radiation with high penetrability. They describe various experimental methods used to study these rays, including pressure chambers, electron counters, and the detection of secondary radiation. The author also considers different theories about the nature of ultra-penetrating rays, such as whether they are waves, electrons, or material particles. Despite the progress made in studying these rays, the exact nature of ultra-penetrating radiation remains unclear.
